channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024040723
item.description:
Report X-2024040723

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11th, a package was observed to have smoke coming out of it during the sort. The package was removed to the outside of the facility in case a full fire erupted. Emergency services were not called to examine the package. Shortly after the smoke lessened and the box was no longer hot to the touch. The package was brought in and examined and it was determined that there were four non-spillable batteries inside, two of which showed scorch marks from a small fire. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being help pending disposition. The NRC was notified of the fire at approximately 2300, report # 1396190.

  • Description: AFTER LOADING OPERATIONS WERE COMPLETED, THE DRIVER CONDUCTED A SLOSH TEST ON THE TRAILER. WHILE CONDUCTING THE TEST THE REAR DOME LID WAS LOOSE AND PRODUCTED LEAKED OUT ONTO THE PAVEMENT. DOME LID WAS SECURED AND THERE WAS NO FURTHER LEAKING. PRODUCT CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONELL.

item.title: Report E-2024040430
item.description:
Report E-2024040430

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 50-pound box of UN2821 was damaged during unloading and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the UN2821-impacted dock floor. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and all damaged containers were then placed into one (1) 55-gallon overpack. Both drums were then staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040375
item.description:
Report E-2024040375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, three (3) pallets of one-gallon pails of paint were damaged due to improper securement during shipping and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected and containerized 196 1-gallon pails of UN1263 into five (5) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal purposes. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged cardboard and all UN1263 impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) 30-gallon drums for disposal purposes.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking granules from the outer container when it was unloaded. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote. Upon inspection of the content we found the bucket inside had a crack on the underside of the body causing it to leak about 20oz of granules. All clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The body of the bucket cracked on the underside causing it to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040493
item.description:
Report X-2024040493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to head towards load side 3 and upon arrival QA was notified that the package was leaking. Once QA was notified of damaged hazmat they then quarantined the area ran to get the apropriate gear and items to bag the package. Once they bagged all the packages they then nutralized the spilled content and cleaned the area. DescribePack: Upon inspection the bottom was wet and when we opened the package we inspected all bottles inside and noticed that there was a crack at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: quarantined the area and placed spill mats and then spreaded out nutrilizing agent.

DescribePack: Side of bottle, where the top of the cylinder meets the cone part of the bottle broke open. Very small crack. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2024040525
item.description:
Report X-2024040525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package came back to the end of the vanline and it was placed on the floor flush to the back wall of the vanline. The cause of the damage is unknown but the outer box did not indicate it was a hazmat. Inner box had all the necessary markings. DescribePack: upon discovery the outer box had a wet spot on it like it had been dripped down internally. At the time I did not know it was a hazmat as the outer box did not have any markings on it to indicate that it was a hazmat. The inner box had a large wet spot on the top and partially down both sides of the inner box. Other than that there wasnt any other kind of damage to the outer or inner box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once I discovered it was a hazmat I had to run to the sink and thoroughly wash my hands as I had touched the wet part of the box. When I returned I put on nitrile gloves, grabbed a hazmat bag, and put the damaged package into a red lined bin. I then used some absorbent pads to soak up and wipe down the surface area where the box had been located.

Upon inspection we found one of the four bottles crushed causing it to leak about 15oz on to the outer container. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The body of one of the four bottles was crushed causing it to leak from cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040459
item.description:
Report X-2024040459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: ANAHEIM

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver discovered wet box in truck and brought package back to station where PPE's and absorbent were used to clean up the spill.   • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior packaging was wet on one side and was torn on the opposite side of it. White powdered granules was spilling out of the box. Inside were 25 different pool products all jammed up in one box. DescribePack: 3 bottles of 907 gram each of Leisure Time Brominating Granular had the top of the body crushed with the cap pushed inward. Indicative of a the bottle getting crushed far heavier than the 3 bottles can withstand together. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The powder granules were swept with broom and the whole package was placed inside a plastic lined container for a safer movement to HMPA for a better inspection.

On the way to its destination to the shipper, it was discovered that the outer packaging was discolored , wet and a palpable chemical odor came from the box. . The package was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: Both of the inner cans were dented , and the one that spilled the most liquid had its cap completely separated from the body. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent material, the rest of the shipment was put into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-cups of GreenClean PRO were released from one (1) 50-pound plastic bag due to another pallet colliding with the bag, causing it to tear and spill out onto the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will place the contents into a 10-gallon metal drum. The terminal stated they will transfer the contents over to a 10-gallon poly drum and they will place plastic lining inside the metal drum that previously held the spill.

  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the outer container while being unloaded. Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote. Upon inspection we discovered the bottle top was loose causing it to leak approx. 1ltr. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The bottle had a loose cap causing to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040221
item.description:
Report X-2024040221

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE FOR PROPER TRANSPORTATION TO VAN LINE, THE LEAKAGE WAS NOTED. THE AREA WAS CLEARED, PPE ALONG WITH NEUTRALIZER WAS RETRIEVED. NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL. BAY DOORS WERE OPENED TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL AIR FLOW. DescribePack: DUE TO THE NATURE OF THE ITEM/SPILL, IT WAS NOT CLEAR AS TO THE EXACT INNER PACKAGE FAILURE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTES PRE-LINED WITH HAZMAT BAGS WERE USED TO PLACE IMPACTED BOXES INTO, WHICH STEMMED THE LEAKAGE AND REDUCED ADDITIONAL VAPOR DISPERSION. IN ADDITION, CHEMICAL NEUTRALIZER WAS APPLIED TO THE SPILL.
